Column Comment.0: STANDARD METHOD SET IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a set or group ofstandard methods. Often, these would identify a method, consisting of severaldifferent steps, that are included in a typical analysis.
Column Comment.1: STANDARD METHOD SET IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a set or group ofstandard methods. Often, these would identify a method, consisting of severaldifferent steps, that are included in a typical analysis.
Column Comment.2: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: LONG NAME: Common long name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.7: METHOD DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the method for the sampleanalysis. For example if the method is grinding the description should includeinformation about how small the granules should be grinded or in titration if a certaincolor is suppose to appear after the addition of a certain amount of titrant.
Column Comment.8: METHOD SEQUENCE NUMBER: Identifies the sequence in which this step istypically conducted during an analysis. Note that the actual order may vary; thiscolumn merely indicates where it would normally occur.
Column Comment.9: METHOD TYPE: The type of step that is applied during this method, such asgrinding, polishing, pyrolysis, slicing, spectroscopy, microscope analysis, countingetc.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: SAMPLE PREPARATION CLASS: the type or class of preparation for the sample,such as a chemical wash, thin section, acid wash etc
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SHORT NAME: Common short name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The literature reference for this analysis method.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
